text: Magdalen College is one of the colleges of the University of Oxford. The Bishop of Winchester, William of Waynflete, founded the college in 1458. The full name of the college is "The President and Fellows of the College of St. Mary Magdalene in the University of Oxford". At dawn on May Day, the College choir sings hymns from the top of the Magdalen Tower. Large crowds gather each year on Magdalen Bridge to hear the choir. "Jumpers flout May Day bridge ban", BBC News (May 1, 2008) ==References== Category:Colleges of the University of Oxford Category:1450s establishments Category:15th-century establishments in England
title: Magdalen College, Oxford
